result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey C. Bloom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
May be served in Polk County, or any county in Wisconsin, as long as no electronic monitoring.
Report no later than 6 p.m. on 2-14-16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey C. Bloom

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey C. Bloom in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:43 a.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to ct 2, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs, 15 days jail, ask to serve in Polk Co jail w/60 days to report. Ct 1 dismiss and read in. State agrees. Def agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 2 - guilty. Ct 1 dismissed and read in. State clarifies that charge is as a repeater. Court explains and Def still wishes to enter guilty plea. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Atty Grubofski satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 2 misd bail jumping as repeater. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. State has complied with VWNR. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, counseling as recommended, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, 15 days jail, may be served in Polk Co, or any county in Wisconsin that will accept, as long as no electronic monitoring, report no later than 6 p.m. on 2/14/16. Def advised to contact jail in Langlade Co. about reporting. Stipulate 1 day credit if revoked. Huber.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Jeffrey C. Bloom in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond will continue.  Plea received by Court  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
